reviews.review_msg: If you take pol 316 keep your expectations low, despite the great course name and interesting description, there's not really anything you will get out of this course and the lectures can turn into group therapy sessions when discussing some of the readings. Dr. Fuji-Johnson is a nice prof but is unfortunately a tough grader.

Genevieve is a knowledgeable professor who always leads you to reflect deeper on the topic. However, she is the toughest professor I've ever had. Her expectations for writing work are high, but sometimes, she doesn't give clear guidelines. Being mentally prepared with her. Sometimes you work really hard but still can't get good grades

Genevieve is a super cool women, her lectures are awesome and she make the class super enjoyable. If you need to take this course, take it with her. I don't know why people are writing so many negative reviews, they clearly are just very stupid or have no idea what they're talking about.

Awesome professor! Overall, she is brilliant, has excellent lectures and makes the concept of philosophy very easy. My experience with Dr. Fuji-Johnson has been incredible. She is a cool person, and she appreciates it when you participate actively in lectures, so ensure you keep up with the readings. 10/10

Genevieve is an incredible professor. Her lectures are engaging and meaningful. The readings are powerful. She does her best to help you succeed. As a W course she focuses on improving writing skills. You must work in this class, but if you follow her feedback - which is detailed and helpful - you will do well and become a stronger writer.

Don't expect that the course context will be interesting if you are not interested in political philiosophy. But what you can expect from Dr.Johnson is that she is able to explain the academic term well with comprehensive examples. This helps a lot during the process of learning.

Genevieve Fuji-Johnson is the best professor I have ever met. She is incredibly intelligent, insightful, and thoughtful. She genuinely takes an interest in her field of study. In addition to teaching about the intersection of gender and politics, she is also a sex worker rights advocate and she volunteers her time to support women on the DTES.

Dr. Johnson is a kind and caring woman who is passionate about politics. That being said, her marking criteria appears to be clear but it is not and she penalizes you for the smallest things. Nobody will get an A+ and she does not give full marks even if you have earned it. To succeed you must keep up with readings and participate a lot.

Would not easily give anyone a grade above A, but would not easily fail anyone either. I got a 50% on the course and less than that for participation; I tried hard for the paper and the final exam, and she indicated that I would easily pass. Kind of a socialist in that manner. Everyone usually fits into the middle grade of C+  B+
For the inherent dryness of the class, she is the best out there. Very straightforward with her expectations and genuinely just wants you to learn from the class. Sweetheart.

Took the political philosophy class about a year ago. First, she is enthusiastic. She likes her material and genuinely finds it fascinating. On the other hand, she's short tempered. Generally in a good mood, don't piss her off as it goes downhill fast. But overall a clear and concise professor who was reasonable in most, if not all her expectations.
she is a good prof anyway

I came into this course with no interest in political philosophy, but she has made the course really interesting.  Lectures are actually fun, thought you are expected to participate.  If you say something, be prepared to defend it with real logic.  Your "gut" feeling will not cut it in this class.

Very good lecturer.  She expects you to take notes but speaks slowly and clearly, repeating everything she thinks is important.  There is an obscene amount of reading, but you can get away with just reading her notes for the most part.  Reading this, I expected her to mark hard, I think that she is average in that area.

This prof is all about guidelines, for every assignment she tells you what she is looking for and how much its worth! You cannot slack in her class, do the work and do it well. She appreciates when students speak up and engage in class! She is super nice and has great anecdotal stories

A lot of readings- for sure. Although I'm sure you can get away with it somehow... Dr. Johnson is really passionate in lecture and you can tell she knows her stuff. Exam questions are given in advance which is nice, but the paper is worth 40% so some work needs to be put in that. It can get kind of dry, but if this is your major, she's the one.

Unless it's required, don't take this class. It was extremely boring. Prof seemed genuinely interested in the subject, but that didn't really make a difference. Too many keeners in the class, and the prof loved them. The prof does give you the questions to the final and midterm before you take them, so it was easy (but still painfully boring)

Professor handed out excellent notes, however, it was pretty much her whole seminar and made attendance to her class not as mandatory as most. Only problem with this class I had is the workload, there is an incredible amount of reading to be done (about a book every two lectures), and it was difficult to keep up. Not recommended if not needed.

I was looking forward to this course. The readings were difficult, which is fine, but the prof didn't offer any guidance whatsoever. The grading seemed arbitrary - like she didn't herself know what she expected. She generally seemed unprepared and uninterested in the course and the students. Disappointing. I won't enroll in her classes again.
The professor doesn't lecture, instead relying on student presentations (which were often poor quality). She did not explain or discuss difficult readings. I was disappointed with this class.

Fuji Johnson doesn't lecture, her grading scale follows no logical guide lines and her mood swings are out of control... For the sake of SFU Fuji Johnson should be canned before she is granted tenure...  If you are taking political science at SFU avoid this professor at all costs.
She did a good job at making political philosophy less boring than it already was.  Her part notes were extremely helpful and insightful.  All in all a very good prof.

She's a great prof who is clearly very interested in the subject. She wants you to take your own notes, but also posts hers up online after class. As for the exams, she gives out the questions at least one week in advance so the quality of your writing should be higher because you'had plenty of time to study.

re. comment: teaching Bloom/being feminist - you've got to be kidding? To assume that a professor is somehow "non-feminist" because they teach Bloom is terrible logic. Obviously, you [commenter] have a very limited understanding of academic practice. Good luck.

Dr Fuji Johnson has reasonable standards. This polsci dept is uninspiring. Dr Fuji Johnson offers interesting course topics complimented by important authors - topics and authors otherwise, and shamefully, neglected by the dept. If willing, students will gain much from this professor.
She teaches Allan Bloom, and calls herself a feminist... she is perhaps the only elitist in the Poli. Sci. Department. She does not belong there. She does not mark objectively
Took Pol 210 with her, i am an avg A- student and I got a B- in her class. She is completely full of herself and is the most rude professor I have ever met would never take a class with her again!!!!

Avoid at all costs. I get A's and B's in my other classes but didn't complete her class because she was useless as a prof. Didn't learn a thing...just unnecessary STRESS! Even went to her for help, but she didn't help at all.
A failure as an educator.  The glass ceiling is 80% in this course.  That is it, and that is all.

It is a difficult class, lots of reading and horrible lecture notes.  She is quite full of herself. You are not allowed to speak to her or ask her questions unless you have gone to your TA, her head TA and then her. Horrible class only took it because it was required. Do not recommend it if not needed.
Great prof. Took 3 courses with her and would recommend her highly. The previous student to rate does not know her at all. Genevieve is a sound, gracious, and humble individual.
I received an A- but she is a very tough marker and I would say a bit high on her own horse.
This professor should teach humanities, not POL SCI! Her Political Philosophy course has 6 weeks of Plato, 2 weeks of Aristotle and no Marx, Mills or Rawls. Nice person but completely non-critical.

She is definitely a nice person. However, take a class with her only if you are a woman. If you disagree with her, prepare not to get a mark over a B. She either gives  you an A- if she likes you, or a B if she doesn't. She is a feminist thinker and definitely shows it in her marking and thinking. I would never take a class with her again.
shes a hard prof, her marking is rigid... either you are a B student or an A- student... thats it... but there were no As given out in the class either!

This is not the prof you wanna take unless you are keen on having a disasterous couple of months. She throws 5 different books at you and tells you to read on your own. All you do is read texts on your own while she admires Plato's Republic for 5 weeks straight. Does not really know what she is doing. I would not reccomend!

Spent 5 weeks on Plato's Republic, 2 weeks on Machiavelli, 2 weeks on Aristotle's Politics, 2 weeks on Hobbes 'Leviathan', 1 week on Locke. She tried to stuff way too many books into the course leaving every1 confused & falling behind. Take home midterm, marked extra hard cuz its take home. Class average 65%. Totally wish I never took her class.
Good teacher.  Fair. easy on the eyes.  snobbish. full of herself.  single (surprise).
